li.a: Continuity of Care Core Data Set
Proof of Vaccination Core Data Set

div.p: The published version of the DDCC:VS Core data set will be available in Web Annex A (link forthcoming].

tr.th:
Requirement status for
Continuity of Care

Requirement status for
Proof of Vaccination

tr.td: The full name of the vaccinated person.
The vaccinated person's date of birth (DOB) if known. If unknown, use assigned DOB for administrative purposes.
Complete date, following ISO 8601 (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD)

Unique identifier for the vaccinated person, according to the policies applicable to each country. There can be more than one unique identifier used to link records (e.g. national ID, health ID, immunization information system ID, medical record ID).
This will NOT be restricted to globally accepted identifiers, and will be the responsibility of the Member State to determine how they want to utilize unique identifiers and related extensions.
Documentation of a specific instance of sex information for the vaccinated person.
It is recommended to collect sex. However, it will be up to the Member State to determine which code system to use.
Data needed for each vaccination event
Generic description of the vaccine or vaccine sub-type, e.g. COVID-19 mRNA vaccine, HPV vaccine.
There are no index terms associated with this entity

Inclusion of any particular product or entity in any of these landscape documents does not constitute, and shall not be deemed or construed as, any approval or endorsement by WHO of such product or entity (or any of its businesses or activities).
Vaccine product against Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (medicinal product)
Vaccine product against Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (medicinal product)

Inclusion of any particular product or entity in any of these landscape documents does not constitute, and shall not be deemed or construed as, any approval or endorsement by WHO of such product or entity (or any of its businesses or activities).
Vaccine product containing only inactivated whole Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 antigen (medicinal product)|
Vaccine product containing only inactivated whole Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 antigen (medicinal product)|

Vaccine product containing only recombinant non-replicating viral vector encoding Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 spike protein (medicinal product)|
Vaccine product containing only recombinant non-replicating viral vector encoding Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 spike protein (medicinal product)|

Vaccine product containing only Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 messenger ribonucleic acid (medicinal product)
Vaccine product containing only Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 messenger ribonucleic acid (medicinal product)
Data needed for each vaccination event
The brand or trade name used to refer to the vaccine received.
This data element can be predetermined by a vaccine product registry. If vaccine registry is unavailable, we can capture this as a string.
Data needed for each vaccination event
Name of the manufacturer of the vaccine received. e.g. Serum institute of India, AstraZeneca. If vaccine manufacturer is unknown, market authorization holder is REQUIRED.
This data element can be predetermined by a vaccine product registry. If vaccine registry is unavailable, we can capture this as a string.
Data needed for each vaccination event
Name of the market authorization holder of the vaccine received. If market authorization holder is unknown, vaccine manufacturer is REQUIRED.
This data element can be predetermined by a vaccine product registry. If vaccine registry is unavailable, we can capture this as a string.
Data needed for each vaccination event
Batch number or lot number of vaccine.
Data needed for each vaccination event
Date in which the vaccine was provided.
Complete date, following ISO 8601 (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD)
Data needed for each vaccination event
Data needed for each vaccination event

Date upon which provided vaccination is considered valid. This data should only be considered valid at the time of issuance, as guidance is likely to evolve with further scientific evidence. Any user of this data (Vaccinator, Verifier) should validate this date according to their national policy. In the case of repeated doses, the data field for a subsequent dose should override the data field for a predecessor dose.
Complete date, following ISO 8601 (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD)

This data should only be considered valid at the time of issuance, as guidance is likely to evolve with further scientific evidence. Any user of this data (Vaccinator, Verifier) should validate this date according to their national policy. In the case of repeated doses, the data field for a subsequent dose should override the data field for a predecessor dose.
Data needed for each vaccination event
Total expected doses as defined by Member State care plan and immunization programme policies.
This data element can also be predetermined by a vaccine product registry.
Data needed for each vaccination event
The country in which the individual has been vaccinated.
Data needed for each vaccination event
The name or identifier of the vaccination facility responsible for providing the vaccination.
Data needed for each vaccination event

REQUIRED for PAPER vaccination certificates that have been filled out with handwriting ONLY. A printed paper vaccine certificate does not require the handwritten signature of a health worker. The health worker who provided the vaccination or the supervising clinician's hand-written signature.
Data needed for each vaccination event

OPTIONAL for DIGITAL and PAPER vaccination certificates. The unique identifier for the health worker as determined by the member state. There can be more than one unique identifier used. (e.g. system generated ID, health profession number, cryptographic signature, or any other form of health worker unique identifier). This can be used in lieu of a paper-based signature.
Data needed for each vaccination event
Name of disease vaccinated to protect against (such as COVID-19).
Disease caused by Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (disorder)
Disease caused by Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (disorder)
Data needed for each vaccination event
Date on which the next vaccination should be administered, if a next dose is required.
Complete date, following ISO 8601 (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD)
The authority or authorized organization that issued the vaccination certificate.
Unique identifier used to associate the vaccination status represented in a paper vaccination card to its digital representation(s).
Data needed for each vaccination event
Date in which the certificate for a vaccination event became valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date
Complete date, following ISO 8601 (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD)
Data needed for each vaccination event
Last date in which the certificate for a vaccination event is valid. No health or clinical inferences should be made from this date.
Complete date, following ISO 8601 (YYYYMMDD or YYYY-MM-DD)
